oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Influence of Seaweed Extract-treated Tall Fescue on Bovine Antioxidant Activity, Immune Response, and Carcass Characteristics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Saker, K. E.
Allen, V. G.
Pond, K. R.
Miller, M. F.
Bagley, C. P.
Fontenot, J. P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Neotyphodium coenophialumb
endophyte fungus
animal health
production
Tasco™ Forage
tall fescue
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It has been well documented that tall fescue (Festuca arundinaceaa) infected with the endophyte fungus Neotyphodium coenophialumb is associated with production and health problems in beef cattle. Various approaches to overcome the negative, animal-related effects of the endophyte have been investigated without consistent and/or economically feasible outcome. This multi-location study investigated effects of applying Tasco™ Forage, a proprietary seaweed-based product, to endophyte-infected fescue to improve animal health and production.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2000; 156-157
